catalog_info.title: Quine
catalog_info.description: Examination of the works of W. V. Quine, especially Word and Object. Focus on his systematic approach to ontology, knowledge, logic, language, and science; with evaluation of his skeptical claims about meaning and reference (the theses of "indeterminacy of translation" and "inscrutability of reference"), and more generally of the naturalism in philosophy that he urged.
